title: ZUCCHINI PINEAPPLE BREAD
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees and grease a 9x5 or 4 mini loaf pans.
Combine oats and milk and set aside.
In a large bowl, whisk together the flours, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt.
Add the zucchini and dried cherries to the flour mixture.
Combine oat mixture with pineapple, eggs, oil, yogurt, applesauce, vanilla, and nuts.
Add wet mixture to dry ingredients and fold together just till moistened.
Pour batter into prepared loaf pan(s).
Bake for 60 minutes in the 9x5 pan, or 35-40 minutes in the mini loaf pans, or until a toothpick comes out clean.
Cool for 5 minutes in the pan, then remove and finish cooling on a wire rack.
Cool completely before slicing the bread.
ingredients: 1/2 cup milk (I used unsweetened almond milk, but cow or soy milk should work)
1/2 cup dried cherries (raisins or dried cranberries would work too)
2 T. oil (grapeseed, vegetable, or canola will work)
